News.headline: Match Report: North Ferriby United 0 - 4 Dagenham and Redbridge
News.page_title: Match Report: North Ferriby United 0 - 4 Dagenham and Redbridge
News.URL_keywords: Match Report: North Ferriby United 0 - 4 Dagenham and Redbridge
News.short_description: Dagenham & Redbridge made it back-to-back wins in the National League with a 4-0 win at North Ferriby United.
News.description:
Daggers made two changes from Monday’s win over Braintree Town, with Craig Robson replacing Andre Boucaud and Fejiri Okenabirhie coming in for Corey Whitely.

A mix-up at the back almost saw Daggers conced in the 11th minute, but Villagers striker Reece Thompson fired wide after rounding Elliot Justham.

Despite being under pressure early on, Daggers took the lead in the 15th minute when Okenabirhie netted his first goal since October.

And Daggers doubled their lead less than two minutes later when Oliver Hawkins scored off the underside of the crossbar.

In the 23rd minute, North Ferriby had claims of a penalty waved away by referee Steven Rushton.

Seven minutes later, Justham was called into action to keep out a deflected effort from Villagers’ midfielder Connor Oliver.

Luke Guttridge scored Daggers’ third of the afternoon in the 34th minute, slamming home a powerful effort into the top corner of the net.

Justham was called upon once more seven minutes later to keep out Levi Sutton’s shot from the edge of the area.

In the 64th minute, Daggers moved further ahead as Hawkins scored his second goal of the afternoon.

It proved to be the final goal of the afternoon, with Daggers next in action at home to Bromley on January 21.

North Ferriby (4-4-2): Watson; Topliss (Armstrong 82), Gray, Middleton, Hare; Oliver, Fallowfield (Kendall 65), Sutton, Emerton; Bateson, Thompson
Subs: Stamp, Cooke, Skelton

Daggers (4-2-3-1): Justham; Ling, Robson, Staunton, Widdowson; S Donnellan, Raymond (L Donnellan 89); Maguire-Drew (Heard 87), Guttridge, Okenabirhie (White 81); Hawkins
Subs: Cousins, Benson

Attendance: 453

Referee: Steven Rushton
